00002 #include <stdlib.h>
00003 #include <ctype.h>

00005 #define BUFSIZE 1024
00006 
00007 int write_n_bytes(int fd, char * buf, int count);

00009 int main(int argc, char * argv[]) {
00010     char * server_name = NULL;
00011     int server_port = 0;
00012     char * server_path = NULL;
00013 
00014     int sock = 0;
00015     int rc = -1;
00016     int datalen = 0;
00017     bool ok = true;
00018     struct sockaddr_in sa;
00019     FILE * wheretoprint = stdout;
00020     struct hostent * site = NULL;
00021     char * req = NULL;
00022 
00023     char buf[BUFSIZE + 1];
00024     char * bptr = NULL;
00025     char * bptr2 = NULL;
00026     char * endheaders = NULL;
00027    
00028     struct timeval timeout;
00029     fd_set set;
00030 
00031     /*parse args */
00032     if (argc != 5) {
00033         fprintf(stderr, "usage: http_client k|u server port path\n");
00034         exit(-1);
00035     }
00036 
00037     server_name = argv[2];
00038     server_port = atoi(argv[3]);
00039     server_path = argv[4];
00040 
00041 
00042 
00043     /* initialize minet */
00044     if (toupper(*(argv[1])) == 'K') { 
00045         minet_init(MINET_KERNEL);
00046     } else if (toupper(*(argv[1])) == 'U') { 
00047         minet_init(MINET_USER);
00048     } else {
00049         fprintf(stderr, "First argument must be k or u\n");
00050         exit(-1);
00051     }
00052 
00053     /* create socket */
00054     sock = minet_socket(SOCK_STREAM);
00055 
00056     if (sock < 0) {
00057         minet_perror("couldn't make socket ");
00058         exit(-1);
00059     }
00060 
00061     // Do DNS lookup
00062     site = gethostbyname(server_name);
00063 
00064     if (site == NULL) {
00065         fprintf(stderr, "INVALD SERVER\n");
00066         exit(-1);
00067     }
00068 
00069 
00070     /* set address */
00071     memset(&sa, 0, sizeof(sa));
00072     sa.sin_port = htons(server_port);
00073     memcpy(&sa.sin_addr, site->h_addr_list[0], site->h_length);
00074     sa.sin_family = AF_INET;
00075 
00076     /* connect socket */
00077     rc = minet_connect(sock, &sa);
00078     if (rc < 0) {
00079         minet_perror("couldn't connect ");
00080         exit(-1);
00081     }
00082     
00083     /* send request */
00084     req = (char *)malloc(strlen("GET  HTTP/1.0\r\n\r\n") +
00085                          strlen(server_path) + 1);  
00086     sprintf(req, "GET %s HTTP/1.0\r\n\r\n", server_path);
00087 
00088     rc = write_n_bytes(sock, req, strlen(req));
00089     if (rc < 0) {
00090         minet_perror("couldn't write request to server ");
00091         exit(-1);
00092     }
00093 
00094     /* wait till socket can be read */
00095     FD_ZERO(&set);
00096     FD_SET(sock, &set);
00097 
00098     memset(&timeout, 0, sizeof(timeout));
00099     timeout.tv_usec = 0;
00100     timeout.tv_sec = 20;
00101 
00102     rc = select(sock + 1, &set, 0, 0, 0); //decided not to use timeout for now
00103     if (rc < 0) {
00104         minet_perror("select failed ");
00105     } else if (rc == 0) {
00106         minet_perror("timeout ");
00107     }
00108 
00109     if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &set)) {
00110         fprintf(stderr, "socket can't be read\n");
00111         exit(-1);
00112     }
00113     
00114     /* first read loop -- read headers */
00115     while ((rc = minet_read(sock, buf + datalen, BUFSIZE - datalen)) > 0) {
00116         datalen += rc;  
00117         buf[datalen] = '\0';
00118 
00119         if ((endheaders = strstr(buf, "\r\n\r\n")) != NULL) {
00120             //endheaders[2] = '\0';
00121             endheaders += 4;
00122             break;
00123         }
00124     }
00125 
00126     if (rc < 0) {
00127         minet_perror("Couldn't get headers ");
00128         exit(-1);
00129     }   
00130     
00131     /* examine return code */   
00132     bptr = buf;
00133     bptr2 = strsep(&bptr," "); //Skip "HTTP/1.0"
00134     bptr2[strlen(bptr2)] = ' ';  //remove the '\0'
00135     bptr2 = strsep(&bptr, " "); //bptr2 is now pointing to the return code
00136 
00137     if (atoi(bptr2) != 200) {
00138         ok = false;
00139         wheretoprint = stderr;
00140     }
00141     bptr2[strlen(bptr2)] = ' '; //remove the '\0'
00142 
00143     /* print first part of response */
00144     if (!ok) {
00145         fprintf(wheretoprint, "%s", buf); //print everything read so far
00146     } else {
00147         fprintf(wheretoprint, "%s", endheaders); //print everything after headers
00148     }  
00149 
00150     /* second read loop -- print out the rest of the response */
00151     while ((rc = minet_read(sock, buf, BUFSIZE)) != 0) {
00152 
00153         if (rc < 0) {        
00154             minet_perror("not all data read ");
00155             break;
00156         }
00157 
00158         datalen += rc;
00159         buf[rc] = '\0';
00160         fprintf(wheretoprint, "%s", buf);
00161     }
00162         
00163     //fprintf(wheretoprint,"TOTAL BYTES READ: %d bytes\n",datalen);
00164     
00165     /*close socket and deinitialize */
00166     free(req);
00167     minet_close(sock);
00168     minet_deinit();
00169 
00170 
00171     if (ok) {
00172         return 0;
00173     } else {
00174         return -1;
00175     }
00176 }
00177 
00178 int write_n_bytes(int fd, char * buf, int count) {
00179     int rc = 0;
00180     int totalwritten = 0;
00181 
00182     while ((rc = minet_write(fd, buf + totalwritten, count - totalwritten)) > 0) {
00183         totalwritten += rc;
00184     }
00185     
00186     if (rc < 0) {
00187         return -1;
00188     } else {
00189         return totalwritten;
00190     }
00191 }
